meanings.definition: Treat (a person or animal) badly or roughly.
meanings.sent1: The poor dog was mistreated by its cruel owner.
meanings.sent2: The neglected cat was mistreated by the neighborhood kids.
meanings.sent3: He mistreated the remote control, causing it to malfunction.
meanings.sent4: The old book felt mistreated after being left out in the rain.
meanings.sent5: The delicate flower wilted when mistreated by harsh sunlight.

meanings.definition: Handle or manage (a situation or thing) without care or attention.
meanings.sent1: She mistreated the fragile vase, causing it to shatter.
meanings.sent2: The careless chef mistreated the fresh ingredients, ruining the dish.
meanings.sent3: He mistreated the puzzle pieces, mixing them all up in confusion.
meanings.sent4: The tired mechanic mistreated the engine, leading to a breakdown.
meanings.sent5: The distracted student mistreated the assignment, resulting in a low grade.
